Adding Management Commands

Extension functions allow libconflate consumers to easily provide new management functionality specific to their own applications. More...

Variables

enum conflate_mgmt_cb_result(* conflate_mgmt_cb_t )(void *opaque, conflate_handle_t *handle, const char *cmd, bool direct, kvpair_t *pair, conflate_form_result *r, void *userdata)
 Callback invoked to process a management command.

Detailed Description

Extension functions allow libconflate consumers to easily provide new management functionality specific to their own applications.

Register your callbacks with conflate_register_mgmt_cb and libconflate will take over from there.

typedef struct _conflate_form_result conflate_form_result

Callback response form builder.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum conflate_mgmt_cb_result

Callback return types indicating status and result type of a management callback.

Enumerator:
RV_OK 

Invocation worked as expected.

RV_ERROR 

Invocation failed.

RV_BADARG 

Bad/incomplete arguments.

void conflate_init_form ( conflate_form_result *  r  ) 

Initialize the result form if it's not already initialized.

This is useful for the case where an empty form may be desirable.

If a callback is issued that returns without adding fields or calling conflate_init_form, no form will be returned.

If conflate_init_form is called and no fields are added, an empty form will be returned.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void conflate_next_fieldset ( conflate_form_result *  r  ) 

Create a response container for a multi-set response.

This is used for callbacks that want to build tabular results (i.e. a list of k/v pairs).

Parameters:
r the form as handed to the callback
Examples:
examples/bot.c.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void conflate_register_mgmt_cb ( const char *  cmd,
const char *  desc,
conflate_mgmt_cb_t  cb,
void *  userdata 
)

Register a management command handler.

Callbacks allow applications using libconflate to register arbitrary callbacks to extend the capabilities of the management layer.

There are three major forms of success results:

  • Empty (no specific results necessary)
  • A simple key/multi-value list.
  • A list of key/multi-value lists.

See the definition of conflate_mgmt_cb_t for more information on result types.

Parameters:
cmd the node name of the command
desc short description of the command
cb the callback to issue when this command is invoked
userdata user data to be supplied to the callback
Examples:
examples/bot.c.

Variable Documentation

enum conflate_mgmt_cb_result(* conflate_mgmt_cb_t)(void *opaque, conflate_handle_t *handle, const char *cmd, bool direct, kvpair_t *pair, conflate_form_result *r, void *userdata)

Callback invoked to process a management command.

Parameters:
opaque registered opaque value
handle the conflate handle
cmd the name of the command being executed
direct if true, this is a directed command (else issued via pubsub)
pair the form sent with this command (may be NULL)
r the result form being built
userdata the user data registerd with this callback
